intro: Rhigozum somalense, commonly known as the Somali sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to store water. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to harsh, dry environments. It is often found in coastal and inland areas where it thrives under minimal rainfall conditions. Due to its unique adaptations, Rhigozum somalense plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
